description: Requirement:- The consultant team working collaboratively with PCA and as a cohesive multi-disciplinary team, is to achieve a culvert crossing design for the reconstruction of the Lake Audy Road Crossings at Km 18 and 26.- Bidders’ Conference: A bidders' conference will be held via teleconference on November 17, 2022. The conference will begin at 10:00 AM CST. The scope of the requirement outlined in the bid solicitation will be reviewed during the conference and questions will be answered. It is recommended that bidders who intend to submit a bid participate.  Enquiries- All inquiries of a technical and contractual nature are to be submitted to the Contracting Authority.- Enquiries regarding this bid must be submitted in writing and should be received no later than eight (8) business days prior to the date set for solicitation closing to allow sufficient time to provide a response.  Expected Start Date:     - See Appendix “D” for the Project Schedule.",
full_summary:
# Lake Audy Road Crossing Design - Riding Mountain National Park
==============================================

## Tender Information
------------------------

* **Project ID:** 5P468-22-0172/A
* **Tender Status:** Expired
* **Contracting Entity:** Government of Parks Canada

## Request for Proposal Summary
---------------------------------

The Government of Parks Canada invites consultant teams to submit proposals for the design of a culvert crossing for the reconstruction of the Lake Audy Road Crossings at Km 18 and 26 in Riding Mountain National Park. A collaborative multi-disciplinary team will be required to work with Parks Canada to achieve the culvert design.

## Project Timeline
---------------------

The project timeline is outlined in the appendices, specifically in Appendix "D".

## Tender Description
------------------------

The candidate will need to provide a clear, detailed response to the tender requirements. Key components of the tender include:

* A collaborative team approach to achieve a cohesive culvert design
* Collaborative team meetings and coordination with Parks Canada to ensure progression and final submission
* Timely completion of all tasks according to the project timeline

## Evaluation Criteria
-------------------------

The evaluation criteria will be based on the following:

* Team expertise and experience in similar projects
* Collaborative team approach and coordination with Parks Canada
* Deliverables as outlined in the tender requirements

## Submission Instructions
---------------------------

Submissions are to be received via email at soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Proposals must meet the requirements outlined in the submission instructions, including a clear and concise response to the tender requirements. Late submissions will not be considered.

## Important Notes
---------------------

* National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
* Bidders must register on the Government of Canada Tenders website at [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca) to access the tender documents and submission portal.
* The Government of Canada is not responsible for submissions sent via SAP Ariba. Submissions must be received via email or fax as outlined in the submission instructions.

References:
- This text follows the guidelines outlined by the Canadian government procurement guidelines. For more information please refer to [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca).
- For specific tender details and requirements, please consult the tender document, which can be accessed online through the Government of Canada Tenders website. [canadab
